pullRequest.body:
`Algebra.Polynomial.RingDivision` is a bag grab of lemmas with absolutely no running theme. This PR moves two thirds of them to earlier files with no proof change.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Please make sure all authors on the deleted file are accounted for and then merge after CI succeeds. 

bors delegate+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Please make sure all authors on the deleted file are accounted for and then merge after CI succeeds.

Not sure what "accounted for" means here but
1. The file is not deleted
2. The copyright header (and module doc!) is manifestly a copy-paste of `Algebra.Polynomial.Roots`
3. From a quick read through the file's history, most of it was written after the first commit, so the author list has no chance of being accurate
4. No series of lemmas that was moved makes up for more than a small fraction of their new file, so changing the list of authors there wouldn't be appropriate
5. I am lazy and not looking forward to figuring out authorship of a hundred lemmas ðŸ˜…

In short: I won't do anything about authors.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11461749781/job/31891493951)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11461749781/job/31891493097)
It looks a little weird to me to move add_ neg_ and sub_ but not smul_ and the bundled version. What's stopping us from moving these two as well?
This one and the previous clearly have strong commonalities, if we can't keep them together then let's be sure to add docstrings referencing the other

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Polynomial/RingDivision): move lemmas earlier
